title: How to Make a Bunch of Grapes from Balloons

steps.headline: On the craft paper, draw the type of leaves that you’d see on a grapevine.
steps.description: Each bunch should have about two leaves on stems; the pairing makes the bunch seem even.

steps.headline: Cut out the leaves.
steps.description: Be sure to include stems––these will be the part that get stuck to the balloon.

steps.headline: Form the bunch.
steps.description: Use double sided tape to stick the balloons together to form a bunch. Have the grapes at different levels, cascading down in a triangle shape.

steps.headline: Tie the string you’ll hang the bunch from on the top "grape", before adding the leaves.
Tape the leaves around the knot end of each balloon.
steps.description: Tape the stem part of the cut-out leaves. Have the leaves bend down over the "grapes".

steps.headline: Hang the grape balloon bunch from the string length.
steps.description: Hang a row of grape bunch balloons across a room for a fantastic vineyard effect.

text: Making the leaves On the craft paper, draw the type of leaves that you’d see on a grapevine. Each bunch should have about two leaves on stems; the pairing makes the bunch seem even. Cut out the leaves. Be sure to include stems––these will be the part that get stuck to the balloon. Making the grape bunch Form the bunch. Use double sided tape to stick the balloons together to form a bunch. Have the grapes at different levels, cascading down in a triangle shape. Tie the string you’ll hang the bunch from on the top "grape", before adding the leaves.  Tape the leaves around the knot end of each balloon. Tape the stem part of the cut-out leaves. Have the leaves bend down over the "grapes". Hang the grape balloon bunch from the string length. Hang a row of grape bunch balloons across a room for a fantastic vineyard effect.
